Today is not “Happy” Memorial Day. This day is to honor those who have died while in military service. Some people unknowingly confuse today with Veteran’s Day in November, which celebrates the service of all U.S. military veterans. 
I think about and am grateful to my brothers and sisters in arms who gave it ALL during service to our great nation. In particular, today I’m thinking about the C-130 crash earlier this month in Georgia where the Air Force lost nine crew members at once, all from Puerto Rico. You will not be forgotten. 🇺🇸🇵🇷 #USAF #PRANG #MemorialDay

OK, so it’s been a while since I’ve been in FREEZING weather.  As I’m driving LJ to the bus stop this morning, it’s 27 (fu*#^n) degrees outside (in Florida!!), I turn on the wipers and spray a little water like I usually do to clear a smudge on the windshield (as I’m driving). Instantly,  a thin layer of ice forms on my windshield so I can’t see! Wipers are going fast, ice on windshield and the car is moving! So, I do what any other rational person would do...I roll down my window and stick my head out until I get to the bus stop!! Yeah, I looked just like you’re imagining right now. 
My immediate thought was ‘I hope I don’t hit anyone walking in the streets’ and LJ is going to be REALLY embarrassed pulling up at the bus stop w/ his Dad looking like this. But nope, I look over and he has tears in his eyes from laughing so hard at me. 
Well, there you have it. After that incident, no caffeine needed this morning...I’ve already had my dose of freezing weather and adrenaline to wake me up, thank you very much! Hope you’re having a better day. Stay warm. #FloridaProblems #WaterBecomesIceBelow32Degrees

Les presento la carátula de mi nuevo sencillo, “Puerto Rico Se Levanta.” Como prometido, les contaré un poco sobre la foto y porqué luce en la portada…

Con el pase del huracán María en Puerto Rico ví por los medios sociales muchas fotos de la devastación que María dejó en su arrastre a la Isla. ¡Que azotón! Como muchos desde ‘afuera’ me encontraba en un estado de shock mirando fotos de la devastación incansablemente hasta que frente a mi llegaron un par de fotos que me impactaron…fuerte. Eran fotos de lugares que yo bien conocía en mi pueblo donde los daños cambiarían el paisaje para siempre…nunca será igual. Ésta foto en la portada de mi nuevo sencillo fué una de ellas. 
La foto fué tomada alto en las montañas de Utuado, mi pueblo, a solo días después del huracán. Utuado fué una de las áreas más afectadas. Al mirar esta foto noté algo muy especial y diferente a las demás. Las fotos que presentaban devastación también traían angustia, dolor, y falta de esperanza. Precisamente, eso fué lo que me impactó de esta foto, el Flamboyán aún de pié, sin hojas, humillado, y achantado, pero todavía en su puesto como buen soldado vigilando sobre su pueblo…con esperanza de volverse a levantar. Así veo mi Puerto Rico. Asi veo mi gente. Aunque nos dieron fuerte, nos vamos a levantar. 
La imagen no fué captada por un periodista ni con cámara professional. Fué captada por mi tía (Wilma Rodríguez de Orama) con su teléfono móvil frente a su casa en su batey. Aprovechó un momento donde logró conectarse con su móvil para dejarme saber que estaba bien, y me la envió porque ella sabe lo que significa para mi. El día que me llegó la foto ya estaba en el estudio grabando “Puerto Rico Se Levanta.” Al enseñarle la foto a mis compañeros ya todos lo sabíamos, esa era la foto que representaba nuestra canción y tenía que ir en la portada. 
Ese Flamboyán que ven en la foto es el mismo donde mis hijos llegaron admirar, subir y retratarse. Hasta llegaron bajar por la jalda que vigila en yagua. Imagínense el orgullo que sentí al ver que el Flamboyán, aunque completamente desalojado, todavía estaba de pié. Imaginar que algún dia muy pronto volverá a florecer. Volverá como buen soldado con unif

*** ENGLISH ***
This is the CD cover for my new single, "Puerto Rico Se Levanta" (Puerto Rico will rise again). As promised, I will tell you a little about the photo and why I chose it as the cover... With the passing of Hurricane María over Puerto Rico came many photos across social media of the devastation that Maria left in her path on the island. Like many on the 'outside' I was in a state of shock looking at photos of total devastation, but it was not until I saw a small series of photos that I was deeply affected. These were pictures of places I knew well in my town where damages would change the landscape forever ... it will never be the same. This photo on the cover of my new single was one of them.

This photo was taken high in the mountains of Utuado, our hometown, just days after the hurricane. Utuado was one of the most affected areas. Looking at this photo I noticed something very special and different from the others. The photos I had seen of devastation also brought anguish, pain, and hopelessness. It was precisely that (hope), which struck me as different in this photo, the Flamboyán still standing, leafless, humiliated, and practically left for dead, but still at attention in position just as a good soldier would watching over his town ... with hope of rising again. This is how I see my Puerto Rico. That's how I see my people. Although we were knocked down, we're going to get up.

This image was not captured by a journalist or professional camera. It was captured by my aunt (Wilma Rodríguez de Orama) with her cell phone in front of her house in her front yard. She took advantage of a moment where she managed to connect with her cell phone to let me know she was okay, then she sent me the photo because she knows what it means to me. The day that the photo came in I was already in the studio recording "Puerto Rico Se Levanta." As I showed the photo to my colleagues we all knew, that was the photo that represented our song and HAD to go on the cover.

That Flamboyán you see in the photo is the same one my children came to admire, climb, and take ‘selfies’ in. They even slid down that hill it overlooks on homemade slides (yagua). Imagine the pride

I’ve never written anything so passionate. What happened in Puerto Rico last month affected me deeply. I felt helpless from the outside looking in and wanted to help the best way I could, so I put pen to paper, my thoughts flowed, and gave it a shot...with Music. 
This is a song acknowledging we were hit hard, but Boricuas are strong, and united, Puerto Rico will rise again. Working on release date. I will reveal CD Cover (Artwork) for my new single Friday, Oct 27, 2017 at 12:00 p.m. (noon - Miami time) and will tell you the story behind it. #StayTuned #PuertoRicoSeLevanta

Day #9. Toughest part so far has been dealing with my left eye being open all the time. Have to manually "blink" eye. #BellsPalsy #DryEye  #WateryEye. #AnnoyingEye
¡FELIZ VIERNES! 🌴🌴🎉🎤🎶🎶🌴😜😜

Woke up w/ my face half-paralyzed last Friday. Went to see the Doc & long story short, I've been diagnosed w/ Bell's Palsy. 
It's a TEMPORARY condition caused by any number of things and recovery time is anywhere between 2 wks-6 mos, very few suffer permanent damage. Mine was most likely brought on by upper respiratory infection...I let a cold go untreated too long :-( Most people recovered well; I hope the same for me. Since half of my face is temporarily paralyzed it's been a "fun" experience. Thought I would share with you the good and the bad.
1. THE BAD: Can't drink out of a straw (can't control half my lips so I just make a mess)
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: Now I don't look like a sissy drinking out of a straw
2. THE BAD: Left eye doesn't close so I have to wear an eye-patch to protect my eye (cornea) from debris and wind irritation. I have to either tape down my eyelid or manually blink it to avoid tearing up
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: I get to wear an eye-patch and look like a real Pirate, Arrrgh!
3. THE BAD: Food tastes "funny" (taste buds are shot)
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: Great time to expand my diet since my taste buds are on break
4. THE BAD: Can only chew on one side because only half of my mouth opens
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: Saves me time when flossing...I can floss in half the time! As a bonus, I get to lose weight by eating less!
5. THE BAD: One ear sounds too low, while the other is too loud
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: Now have a built-in monitor and it sounds better than most monitors I use on stage (musician joke, LOL)
6. THE BAD: Only half of my face smiles (lips, eyebrows, cheeks), only one eyebrow goes up
*ON THE PLUS SIDE: Wrinkles on half of my face are less visible (relaxed skin), I can raise one eyebrow like The Rock, and if this condition sticks around through Halloween, I have the perfect Two-Face costume...all I have to do is draw a line right down the middle of my face!
In all seriousness "message received" to take care of myself, cut down the stress, and focus on what's really important. I'll have to TEMPORARILY cut live performances but will maintain online. Thx to my fam for taking care of me. #bellspalsy

TONIGHT I"ll be making a SPECIAL APPEARANCE w/ Orq Urbana LIVE performing my new hit single "NOS ENTENDEMOS."

On a personal note...
I don't strive to be better singer/musician than everyone else, I strive to be the best musician I can be. That's it! I completely get that my best may not be as good as other's best...I'm ok with that. It is what it is. I can honestly tell you that I truly enjoy surrounding myself w/ musicians/singers that are better than me. It's so exciting for me to be in their company when beautiful music is created. In the end I can only worry about what I can control, and that's ME. Thank you all for allowing me to share my musical experiences w/ you. I will continue as long as God allows me to, and as long as I continue to receive support. :-) #QueVivaLaSalsa #IvanMontero

videos.caption: Well, like they say, if you don’t like the weather in Florida, wait 15 minutes. LOL! Today, we got it all at once. Here’s the proof! 😂🌈🌴⛈⚡️💦💨☀️#MoodyFloridaWeather #LoveFlorida

¡GRACIAS! Los quiero. 
Nivel de recuperación: 87.38% 😜
- Ivan 
#BellsPalsy #ParalisisFacial

Me siento entre familia con ustedes, so aquí les dejo un corto vídeo de lo que está sucediendo con mi parálisis facial (Bell's Palsy). Ya hoy es el día #17, pero poco a poco mejorando. GRACIAS a todos ustedes por sus mensajes, llamadas, apoyo, oraciones, y buenas vibras. A la verdad que me siento bendecido tener personas en mi vida como ustedes. Al igual, saben que pueden contar conmigo. ¡Los quiero! 😜😜🎉🇵🇷🌴🎶🎶🎤🎉🌴 #QueVivaLaSalsa  #BellsPalsy
